calloutBox.title: Helpful Hippos
calloutBox.subTitle: 19 month to 23 month
calloutBox.content: Our Helpful Hippos program has twelve toddlers ranging from approximately 19 months through approximately 23 months old. We have 3 consistent and nurturing staff caring for our toddlers daily.

mainContent.title: Program Details
mainContent.content: During their time in the Helpful Hippos classroom, they will experience a morning circle time, small group activities centered around art, colors/shapes and texture table, and an outside recess time. Each child in our Helpful Hippos classroom is taking one nap a day, enjoying our nutritional menu, and learning to use utensils. Each child will be given an opportunity to be introduced to potty training as well. Our loving teachers will be spending time with all the children throughout the day.
list: Feeding, naps, and toileting are recorded daily
Personal cot and storage area provided
Parents provide an extra set of clothes, crib sheet, and diapers
Room is enhanced with in-floor heating
Special art and other age development projects
Weekly Bible stories and prayers before meals

boxes.title: Ms. Heather - Lead Teacher
boxes.text: I went to MCC and earned my Associates Degree in Early Childhood Development. Ever since then I have been working with children! When I’m not working, I am hanging out with my two daughters. In my spare time, I love being outside, enjoying the beach, and spending time with my family.

boxes.title: Ms. Brittany
boxes.text: I graduated from Lowell High School in 2011 and I have a daughter who is my world. My fiancé and I plan on getting married in September of 2018. Outside of work, I enjoy listening to music, watching shows, and being outdoors! Spring is my favorite time of the year because the weather is not too hot and not too cold!

boxes.title: Ms. Danie
boxes.text: I graduated from NorthPoine Christian School in 2016 and am now attending Cornerstone University for a degree in Early Childhood Education. I have two wonderful parents and four brothers who have always been there for me. I love to spend time hanging out with friends getting coffee and playing with the little ones at Big Steps.

boxes.title: Ms. Dustie
boxes.text: I graduated from NorthPoine Christian School in 2016 and am now attending Cornerstone University for a degree in Early Childhood Education. I have two wonderful parents and four brothers who have always been there for me. I love to spend time hanging out with friends, getting coffee, and playing with the little ones at Big Steps.
